commitResults.messageTitle: Add skeletal version of Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Lets add in code to make the program greet the user
and then exits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add user interactions to program
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class: greet and say bye to user

Duke class needs more functionality to interact with users. It does
not allow users to enter any inputs.

Lets add in the functionality of echoing commands that
users has entered.
The program will exit when user enters "bye" to prevent it from
running indefinitely.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to store text by user
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class: echo messages entered by user

We need to have the ability to store texts entered by user.

Lets create a new class called Items to keep a record of texts
entered by user up to a maximum of 100 texts.

It has a public method addToList to add a text entered by user.
It has a public method printList to display all the text entered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
Items class: keep track of the list of user text inputs

We need a way for the Item class to keep track of the status of the
task.

Lets rename the Items class to be called TaskManager and it's
methods to better reflect the purpose of the class.
Added setTaskDone method to TaskManager class.

I also added a new class called Task to keep track of the task
description and whether if it is done or not.
The Task class has a public method getTaskStatus to return the done
status and description of the task as a string.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to comply with coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Classes Duke, Task and TaskManager currently comply with the coding
standards.

This can affect the readability of the code.

Lets update all the classes and public methods to include a javadoc
and ensure that scope of the variables are defined at the smallest
scope possible.
I also ensured that whitespaces are used in statements to improve
readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for tracking todos, deadlines and events
commitResults.messageBody:
Task class: records the description and isDone boolean
TaskManager class: keep tracks of the list of task class

The task class needs to be split into todos, deadlines, and events.
Each class will have additional attributes: deadlines will have a
by attribute and events will have an at attribute.

Lets have our Task class be the parent class and todo, deadline and
event class will inherit from it.
We will also have a new method splitItem for the TaskManager class
to handle the separation of user input into task and date/time.
We will also have a TaskType enumeration as currently there is only
todo, deadline and event type of tasks, more can be added in the
future.

Using inheritance here is preferred because all three class types
have description and isDone attributes and this reduces repetition.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new text automation testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Lets create tests for our program using I/O redirection technique.

This is because in the future we can be notified if any of our test
failed due to new changes being made.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Duke class for readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class: extract methods from Duke main class

Duke class now have varying levels of abstraction within the main
method.

Lets make the main method in Duke class to have the same level of
abstraction by extracting out lines of code into a method.
I also added static string constants for greetings and named
constants to avoid magic numbers.

Have the same level of abstraction allows us to adhere to SLAP
principle.
Not having magic numbers increases readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Task, Todo, Deadline and Event class for readability
commitResults.messageBody:
There are many single strings that are scattered about in the print
statements, causing code to be hard to read

Lets have named constants for opening and closing of strings to be
printed out. We also have constants for the tick and cross icons.
We also have constants for task tags.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor TaskManager class
commitResults.messageBody:
Extracted methods from other methods to ensure SLAP principle is
maintained.
Magic literals are extracted out as named constants.
Overload deadline and event class's constructors to make it possible
to pass in one argument instead, improves readability.
Added comments to private methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix TaskManager class to follow code standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Lets add a default case to adhere with the code standards for the
splitItem method.
I renamed the descAndTime variable to taskParameters for better
readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add handling of exceptions for Duke class
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class does not handle invalid commands and empty commands which
requires parameters.

Lets create a new method under the Duke class to extract out the
command. If no command is extracted, method will throw an
IllegalCommandException.

Lets also have a new method to extract out the parameters after the
commands. If no parameters are entered, the method will throw an
IndexOutOfBoundsException.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add handling of exceptions for TaskManager class
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskManager does not handle invalid or missing user parameters.

Lets throw a MissingTaskLiteralException if the program does not
detect a /at or /by and prompts the user to re enter a new command.

For setting task to be done, we also handled cases where parameter
passed in is not a integer or the integer is out of range of the
available list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix exceptions in Duke and TaskManager class
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class: Bye command does not exit the program.
TaskManager class: Does not handle situation where list if full.

Lets add in a new BYE enum for extractCommand method to check for
bye command. I also extracted out the error messages as static
string constants. I also changed checking of user input to use
.startsWith() rather than .contains() as it prevents inputs like
"event done" to give a wrong error.

Lets also handle IndexOutOfBoundsException when the program tries to
add a task to a full list.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix and add more test cases
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated runtext.bat file to complile all my java files.
Added in more test cases where error in user input occur and
handled.

commitResults.messageTitle: Divide classes into packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently the classes do not belong to any packages.

Lets group the classes into 2 different packages under the duke
package, the command and task package.

I also extracted out methods in Duke class that pertains to commands
and made a new class called CommandManager.

I also updated the runtest.bat file to ensure that compile path is
correct.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add command delete to command class
commitResults.messageBody:
The command class does not support deleting tasks.

Lets add a new command enum for delete and support detecting the
delete command. Also moved variables taskManager, parameters and
command from main method to class variable as these variables
are scoped under the entire class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete function to TaskManager
commitResults.messageBody:
The TaskManager class is unable to delete tasks from the task list.

Lets first convert the array we have into an ArrayList and replace
all the corresponding array methods with ArrayList methods (such as
.get() and .add()).
Next I added a new method, deleteTask(). I also removed exception
when the ArrayList is full.
Lastly, I added an interface to the taskManager so that it knows to
override the public methods for better abstraction.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test for delete command
commitResults.messageBody:
Added test for deleting command and added interface to list of
classes to compile.
Updated test cases.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to load data from disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Data is current not saved and information will be gone once the
programm exits.

Lets create a FileManager class that can load data from
./data/duke.txt. The Path type is used to pass to the scanner to
ensure cross platform file paths are compatible.

Once data is retrived, we then pass it to the DataParser class to
convert the String text to Task Objects to be added to the
taskManager.

I have also overloaded the Task constructor so that it can accept
isDone boolean.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to save task to hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently we can only load data from our drive but unable to write
to duke.txt.

Lets create a method under FileManager class to write data to
duke.txt. We also created a FileWritable interface for the task
class for it to convert the object to a string to be saved.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test for loading data
commitResults.messageBody:
text-ui-test was not working properly due to the duke.txt file not
being deleted after every file compare.

Lets remove the duke.txt file so that every new test will have an
empty duke.txt file.
Updated compile files for test.

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle file read format error
commitResults.messageBody:
The DataParser class might give errors when the format of duke.txt
is not correct.

Lets handle the exception by creating FileCorruptedException to
throw and this is handled by the FileManager. The FileManager will
then delete the corrupted file and then recreate a new duke.txt.

Added a new test case to test when duke.txt is corrupted

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to create data directory
commitResults.messageBody:
The FileManager does not check if data directory exist and that is
giving the program errors.

Lets get the FileManager to check if data directory exist and then
create the directory is it does not exist.

Fixed line spacing for error messages and updated the test expected
results.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix coding standards violations
commitResults.messageBody:
Fixed some parts of the code that have magic numbers and
boolean parameters are not named correctly.
